summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unspecified recipient, regarding the provision of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the physical delivery of a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery, and references prior shipments of replacement files.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of discovery materials (laptop, hard drive, CD) provided by the prosecution for her review in her criminal case.

persons.name: G. M. Jetter
persons.context: The sender of the email, who coordinated the delivery of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Prosecutor (Jetter) providing discovery materials to the defendant (Maxwell) as part of the legal process.

events.title: Delivery of Discovery to Maxwell
events.description: An AUSA delivered a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell for her review.

events.title: Prior Discovery Shipment
events.description: The prosecution sent a hard drive via FedEx containing a separate discovery production, including replacements for files Maxwell had been unable to review.

keyFacts: On November 18, 2020, the prosecution physically delivered a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The delivery included a new discovery production and was intended to aid Maxwell in reviewing her case materials.
A prior shipment on November 9, 2020, contained replacement files for materials Maxwell had previously been unable to access.
The correspondence highlights the ongoing legal discovery process in Maxwell's criminal case.
The email sender is an Assistant U.S. Attorney, indicating direct involvement by the SDNY prosecution team.
